intro: Jamesonia scammanae, commonly known as the Cape York bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
